cssClasses.name: Text font variant (t-<font-variant>)
cssClasses.description:
Helper to define if serif or sans font is to be used. This uses the @include font-setting mixin, which establishes the font-family according to whether or not the .fonts-loaded class is present.

General rule for this is t-serif for editorial and t-sans for everything else

Note: The default font is t-sans. That means most of the time you won't need to explicitly set it.
cssClasses.label: Text font variant
cssClasses.template: Change inherit font family

cssClasses.name: Text case (t-<case>)
cssClasses.description: Text-transform helpers.
cssClasses.label: Text case
cssClasses.template: Text transform helper.

cssClasses.name: Text align (t-align-<dir>)
cssClasses.description: Text-align helpers.
cssClasses.label: Text align
cssClasses.template: Example

cssClasses.name: Text line-height (t-lh-<size>)
cssClasses.description: Various sizes of unitless line-height.
cssClasses.label: Text line-height
cssClasses.template: Texas again mistakenly flags voters for citizenship reviews

cssClasses.name: Text letter-spacing (t-lsp-<size>)
cssClasses.description: Kerning helpers. We generally use this in conjunction with t-uppercase.
cssClasses.label: Text letter-spacing
cssClasses.template: Texas again mistakenly flags voters for citizenship reviews

cssClasses.name: Text size (t-size-<size>)
cssClasses.description: Font-size helpers according to our scale.
cssClasses.label: Text size
cssClasses.template: Example text

cssClasses.name: Links (t-<link-style>)
cssClasses.description: Apply this to a parent to have descendant a tags inherit the respective link style.
cssClasses.label: Links
cssClasses.template: Block of text in a paragraph. Example of {{ className }}.

cssClasses.name: Headline (t-headline)
cssClasses.description:
This helper is purely used for proper headline sizing.

Other classes needed in headlines:

  • t-serif
  • t-links-underlined-hover (when used in top story or sponsor card ad)
  • t-lh-s
cssClasses.label: Headline
cssClasses.template: Story headline text with link.
cssClasses.preview: Story headline text with link.

cssClasses.name: Kicker
cssClasses.description:
Kickers are used to establish orientation for the current page. In our product, kickers appear as series labels, on topics pages, and newsletter landing pages.

Classes needed:

  • t-uppercase
  • t-lsp-b
  • t-weight-bold
  • has-text-teal
  • l-display-ib (varies with context)
  • has-xxs-btm-marg (varies with context)
cssClasses.label: Kicker
cssClasses.template: New Texas Laws 2019
cssClasses.preview: New Texas Laws 2019

cssClasses.name: Widgethead (t-widgethead)
cssClasses.description:
Widgetheads are colored text headers usually placed above feeds. The markup is mostly comprised of helper classes, but there is one declaration built into the t-widgethead class for padding.

Classes needed:

  • t-uppercase
  • t-lsp-b
  • t-size-xs (varies with context)
  • has-text-black
  • has-bg-white-off
  • has-xxs-btm-marg (varies with context)
cssClasses.label: Widgethead
cssClasses.template: New in series
cssClasses.preview: New in series

cssClasses.name: Sectionhead (t-sectionhead)
cssClasses.description:
Used to separate sections.

Other classes needed in sectionheads:

  • t-uppercase
  • t-lsp-b
cssClasses.label: Sectionhead
cssClasses.template: More in this series »
cssClasses.preview: More in this series »

cssClasses.name: Byline (t-byline)
cssClasses.description:
The only actual function of this class is for spacing out child elements with
.t-byline__item.

Other classes needed in bylines:

  • t-links
  • t-uppercase
  • t-lsp-m
  • t-size-xs (varies with context)
  • has-text-gray-dark
cssClasses.label: Byline
cssClasses.template: by Patrick Svitek July 16, 2019 16 hours ago
cssClasses.preview: by Patrick Svitek July 16, 2019 16 hours ago

cssClasses.name: Text wrap (t-wrap-<setting>)
cssClasses.description: Helper classes for handling how words are allowed to wrap and break.
cssClasses.label: Text wrap
cssClasses.template: barbara.gervin.hawkins@house.texas.gov

cssClasses.name: Text weight (t-weight-<setting>)
cssClasses.description: Helper for adding bold/normal font-weight. Sometimes individual <strong> can be redundant tags.
cssClasses.label: Text weight
cssClasses.template: Example text

cssClasses.name: Caption (c-caption)
cssClasses.description: This is a block of text, which gives context to media. We generally use helper classes for text styles and use this component simply for spacing.
cssClasses.label: Caption

cssClasses.name: CTA block (c-cta-block)
cssClasses.description: Call to action with messaging and buttons. The window size determines the layout. This would be a great use case for container queries. {{isWide}}
cssClasses.label: CTA block
cssClasses.template:
{% if className == 'c-cta-block--horiz-from-bp-m' %}

Stay in the loop

The next time news breaks, hear about it first.

Follow The Texas Tribune on Facebook and Twitter.

Facebook Twitter

Join our nonprofit newsroom

Support our voting rights coverage by becoming a Texas Tribune member today.

Choose an amount to give or learn more about membership.

cssClasses.name: Share (c-share)
cssClasses.description: Grid of social share buttons. Typically the "Republish" button is only used on desktop.
cssClasses.label: Share
cssClasses.template: Republish
cssClasses.preview: Republish

cssClasses.name: Tag (c-tag)
cssClasses.description: Tags can be used to label or categorize items. They're designed to scale according to their inherited font size using ems.
cssClasses.label: Tag
cssClasses.template:
{% if className === 'c-tag--fixed' %}

Jerry Seinfeld Libertarian partyL

Cosmo Kramer Independent partyI

Append .t-size-<any-size> to vary the tag size. R {% else %}
simple tag

This is a paragraph of text, which includes a tag.

Use tags to highlight topics like politics or #txlege.

You can also use them to list topics:

higher education  energy  immigration 

{% endif %}

cssClasses.name: Blast header (c-blast-header)
cssClasses.description: Header for Blast product.
cssClasses.label: Blast header
cssClasses.template:
The best political
newsletter in Texas.
cssClasses.preview:
The best political
newsletter in Texas.

cssClasses.name: Button (c-button)
cssClasses.description: Buttons rely on color helpers for background and text color. The variations are simply sizes. One catch is that are buttons run small in sizes so the names aren't true to their padding and font-size assignments.
cssClasses.label: Button
cssClasses.template: {% if className === 'c-button--circle' %} {% elif className === 'c-button--outline' %} {% else %} {% endif %}
cssClasses.preview:
<button class="c-button ">
    Button
</button>

cssClasses.name: Link button (c-link-button)
cssClasses.description: Sometimes, we need buttons to look like links (see Talk embed log in/log out buttons)
cssClasses.label: Link button
cssClasses.template: <button class="c-link-button">Click me, I'm Irish</button>
cssClasses.preview: <button class="c-link-button">Click me, I'm Irish</button>

cssClasses.name: Full-page loader (c-full-page-loader)
cssClasses.description: For putting a translucent overlay over the entire page. Can contain nested items (including .c-loading), probably with absolute positioning.
cssClasses.label: Full-page loader

cssClasses.name: Icon (c-icon)
cssClasses.description: SVG icon class. Icons will take the size of parent font-size. Default fill is yellow with a helper for white, teal, and gray icons.
cssClasses.label: Icon
cssClasses.template: Words next to the icon!
cssClasses.preview: Words next to the icon!

cssClasses.name: Ad fluid (c-ad-fluid)
cssClasses.description:
Currently, this is only intended to wrap around sponsor content ads, which are implemented through Google's native ad feature. Fluid ads contain more dynamic content than our standard set height x width ads, but we must still declare a height that the browser can anticipate before the ad content loads (aka prevent reflow).

Note: If we start to see more variations of fluid ads in the future, consider making the sponsor styles scoped under a specific modifier. {{isWide}}
cssClasses.label: Ad fluid
cssClasses.template: Native ad goes here
cssClasses.preview: Native ad goes here

cssClasses.name: Back to top (c-back-to-top)
cssClasses.description:
This component is is opinionated on position. There is an optional c-back-to-top-viewport class, which is used to conditionally show back-to-top when the viewport is scrolled for a bit. That feature requires some extra JS.

Note:

  1. Place this class outside of your back to top button because position: sticky works best on direct children of body.
  2. To use position: sticky on Safari, you need a block-level element.
cssClasses.label: Back to top

cssClasses.description: Auto flow grid of child elements. Mobile has a set rule to stack, while larger viewports auto flow based on min/max width rule on child elements. If the container does not allow for each column to be at least 100px, remaining columns will wrap to the next row. {{isWide}}

cssClasses.name: Info drop (c-info-drop)
cssClasses.description: Uses <details> and <summary> tags to create an information dropdown component. This includes fallbacks for IE and Edge, which currently don't support those tags. Edge has marked implementation for those as high-priority. {{isWide}}
cssClasses.label: Info drop
cssClasses.template:
What is a paid post?

Paid posts allow sponsors to reach The Texas Tribune’s policy-minded audience through brand messaging in the form of written articles. The points of view expressed don’t reflect those of the Tribune and sponsors play no role in the Tribune’s editorial decisions. The Texas Tribune is the only member-supported, digital-first, nonpartisan media organization that informs Texans — and engages with them — about public policy, politics, government and statewide issues. Learn more about The Texas Tribune's mission.

Content below is pushed down.

Learn more about The Texas Tribune's mission.

cssClasses.name: Site footer (c-site-footer)
cssClasses.description:
The base footer on our site. Set the layout based on the number of columns needed.

Example CSS for layout:

.c-site-footer__inner {grid-template-columns: repeat(4, 1fr);}

To render the standard footer, use a combination of c-site-footer__inner--standard for layout and c-site-footer__links--standard for proper link spacing.
cssClasses.label: Site footer
cssClasses.template:
{% if className != 'c-site-footer__inner--standard' %}

cssClasses.name: Story body (c-story-body)
cssClasses.description: The approach for c-story-body is different from other components because we use descendant selectors instead of BEM.
cssClasses.label: Story body
cssClasses.template:
Article text formatting preview

Our editor outputs blocks of texts with paragraph tags. This parent class also accounts for descendant links, headings, horizontal rules, and lists.

This is a paragraph with some link text. This is how bolded, emphasized, superscript and subscript text displays.

Lists

Ordered

  1. This is the first item.
  2. This is the second item.
  3. This is the third item.

Unordered

  • This is the first item.
  • This is the second item.
  • This is the third item.

Headings are used to label sections of the text body. The text below is an example of how h2 - h4 tags should be formatted.

Heading level 2

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit. Nam facilis, est error vero distinctio sequi reiciendis ipsam consequuntur enim, aliquam accusamus magni laborum neque reprehenderit labore doloremque nulla ab aspernatur?

Heading level 3 and example of some emphasized text

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit. Nam facilis, est error vero distinctio sequi reiciendis ipsam consequuntur enim, aliquam accusamus magni laborum neque reprehenderit labore doloremque nulla ab aspernatur?

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit. Nam facilis, est error vero distinctio sequi reiciendis ipsam consequuntur enim, aliquam accusamus magni laborum neque reprehenderit labore doloremque nulla ab aspernatur?

Heading level 4 and an example of a heading with a link

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit. Nam facilis, est error vero distinctio sequi reiciendis ipsam consequuntur enim, aliquam accusamus magni laborum neque reprehenderit labore doloremque nulla ab aspernatur?

Horizontal Rules

Use a horizontal rule to break up content. A horizontal rule is displayed below.

The hr tag has built in top and bottom margin. We do this because it's normally used as a spacing element and the need for cushion is assumed.

Plugins

We add container rules to specific descendant selectors like paragraphs, headings, lists etc. That means that most elements nested in this component will not be bound by any container and will need their own max-width.

Plugins should not be bound by any rule in c-story-body. We use separate plugin positioning rules for that.

cssClasses.name: Series promo (c-series-promo)

cssClasses.template:
• Support our ongoing Harvey coverage.

    Donate Now

  • Tell us your Harvey story.

    • Were you affected by Hurricane Harvey?
    • Are you involved in recovery efforts?
    • Tell us your story

cssClasses.name: Story block variation 1 (c-story-block--trending)
cssClasses.description: Used on the homepage. Version of c-story-block with c-story-block--stack-from-bp-m used to display trending stories. This is simplified in that it only displays headline and image.
cssClasses.label: Story block variation 1
cssClasses.template: The best and worst moments in Texas politics of 2019
cssClasses.preview: The best and worst moments in Texas politics of 2019

cssClasses.name: Story block variation 2 (c-story-block--harvey)
cssClasses.description:
Used in series siderail. Implementation the c-story-block--stacked modifier (no columns at any viewport.) We document these here in the off-chance that the flatblock content is wiped-out. The contents of the block might get out of sync, but the layout classes should remain similar to what's documented here.
Live example
cssClasses.label: Story block variation 2
cssClasses.template:
{# We're storing these one-off variations of c-story-block here for safe-keeping because they are used in a flatblock(https://wiki.texastribune.org/display/MAR/Flat+Blocks) Found: https://www.texastribune.org/series/in-harveys-wake/ #}
    {% set text = "Boomtown, Flood Town" %} {% set cta = "https://houston.texastribune.org/boomtown-floodtown/" %} {% set image = siteURL + "/img/story-block/c-story-block-flood-map.jpg" %} {% set image_alt = "Map of Houston area waterways" %} {% set summary = "Climate change will bring more frequent and fierce rainstorms to cities like Houston. But unchecked development remains a priority in the famously un-zoned city, creating short-term economic gains for some while increasing flood risks for everyone." %}

  • {{ text }}

    {{ summary }} Full Story

    • {% set text = "Hell and High Water" %} {% set cta = "https://houston.texastribune.org/hell-and-high-water/" %} {% set image = siteURL + "/img/story-block/c-story-block-flood-map-2.jpg" %} {% set image_alt = "Map showing potential water levels of flooding in Houston suburbs, Seabrook, League City, and Clear Lake home to Johnson Space Center" %} {% set summary = "Houston is the fourth-largest city in the country. It's home to the nation's largest refining and petrochemical complex, where billions of gallons of oil and dangerous chemicals are stored. And it's a sitting duck for the next big hurricane. Learn why Texas isn't ready." %}

  • {{ text }}

    {{ summary }} Full Story
cssClasses.preview:
• Boomtown, Flood Town

    Climate change will bring more frequent and fierce rainstorms to cities like Houston. But unchecked development remains a priority in the famously un-zoned city, creating short-term economic gains for some while increasing flood risks for everyone. Full Story

  • Hell and High Water

    Houston is the fourth-largest city in the country. It's home to the nation's largest refining and petrochemical complex, where billions of gallons of oil and dangerous chemicals are stored. And it's a sitting duck for the next big hurricane. Learn why Texas isn't ready. Full Story

cssClasses.name: Story block variation 3 (c-story-block--tx-lege)
cssClasses.description:
Used in series siderail. Implementation the c-story-block--stacked modifier (no columns at any viewport.) We document these here in the off-chance that the flatblock content is wiped-out. The contents of the block might get out of sync, but the layout classes should remain similar to what's documented here.
Live example
cssClasses.label: Story block variation 3
cssClasses.template:
{# We're storing these one-off variations of c-story-block here for safe-keeping because they are used in a flatblock(https://wiki.texastribune.org/display/MAR/Flat+Blocks) Found: https://www.texastribune.org/series/texas-legislature-2019/ #}
    {% set text = "Mini-documentary series" %} {% set cta = "https://www.texastribune.org/series/under-the-dome/" %} {% set cta_text = "Subscribe to our YouTube channel" %} {% set image = siteURL + "/img/story-block/c-story-block-dome.jpg" %} {% set image_alt = "Texas Capitol dome in the sky." %} {% set summary = "Go beyond the business of passing bills to see the personalities and predicaments lawmakers face throughout the session." %}

  • {{ text }}

    {{ summary }}{{ cta_text }}

    • {% set text = "Elected Officials Directory" %} {% set cta = "https://www.texastribune.org/directory/" %} {% set cta_text = "See who represents you " %} {% set image = siteURL + "/img/story-block/c-story-block-gavel.jpg" %} {% set image_alt = "Gavel resting on table with menu symbol overlaid." %} {% set summary = "Here's a list of the occupants of the state’s highest offices." %}

  • {{ text }}

    {{ summary }}{{ cta_text }}

    • {% set text = "Livestream" %} {% set cta = "https://apps.texastribune.org/features/2019/texas-house-senate-livestreams-86th-legislature/" %} {% set cta_text = "Watch now" %} {% set image = siteURL + "/img/story-block/c-story-block-congressmen.jpg" %} {% set image_alt = "Male politicians sitting at table in front of microphones with play symbol overlaid." %} {% set summary = "Follow the action with our annotated coverage." %}

  • {{ text }}

    {{ summary }}{{ cta_text }}

    • {% set text = "Newsletter" %} {% set cta = "https://www.texastribune.org/about/subscribe/#texas-legislature-weekly" %} {% set cta_text = "Subscribe here" %} {% set image = siteURL + "/img/story-block/c-story-block-speaker-seat.jpg" %} {% set image_alt = "Empty chair belonging to the Speaker of the Texas House of Representatives with email symbol overlaid." %} {% set summary = "Get the latest legislative news in your inbox, delivered weekly on Fridays." %}

  • {{ text }}

    {{ summary }}{{ cta_text }}
cssClasses.preview:
• Mini-documentary series

    Go beyond the business of passing bills to see the personalities and predicaments lawmakers face throughout the session.Subscribe to our YouTube channel

  • Elected Officials Directory

    Here's a list of the occupants of the state’s highest offices.See who represents you

  • Livestream

    Follow the action with our annotated coverage.Watch now

  • Newsletter

    Get the latest legislative news in your inbox, delivered weekly on Fridays.Subscribe here

7 8 9

cssClasses.name: Topic bar (c-topic-bar)

Key coverage

cssClasses.name: Reporters list
cssClasses.description:
Useful for showing a linked headline along with a linked byline and pub date.

Classes needed:

  • has-bg-white
  • has-padding
  • has-text-gray-dark
  • has-b-btm-marg
  • has-xxxs-btm-marg
  • is-rounded-b
  • l-display-ib
  • t-byline
  • t-byline__item
  • t-links
  • t-links-underlined-hover
  • t-size-b
  • t-size-xxs
  • t-size-xxs
  • t-serif
  • t-lh-s
  • t-lsp-l
  • t-uppercase
cssClasses.label: Reporters list
cssClasses.template:
Latest from our reporters

  • Texas education officials recommend replacing Houston ISD's elected school board

    Patrick Svitek Nov. 4, 2019

  • Texas Democrats are suing the state over its move to end temporary voting locations

    Alexa Ura Oct. 30, 2019

  • Elizabeth Warren and Julián Castro may be rivals — but they’re buddies, too

    Alex Samuels Oct. 30, 2019

  • Capitol insiders: Texas Lt. Gov. Dan Patrick is letting the state's budget agency fall apart

    Edgar Walters Oct. 29, 2019
cssClasses.preview:
Latest from our reporters

  • Texas education officials recommend replacing Houston ISD's elected school board

    Patrick Svitek Nov. 4, 2019

    Alex Samuels Oct. 30, 2019

    Edgar Walters Oct. 29, 2019

cssClasses.name: Column grid (l-col-grid)
cssClasses.description: Just testing the waters of a tiny grid helper. For now, used on photo grids and in AMP templates. By default the grid is an even two column grid. We include variations for col counts and spacing.
cssClasses.label: Column grid
cssClasses.template:
1
2
3
4
{% if className === 'l-col-grid--1x3' %}
5
6
{% endif %}
cssClasses.preview:
1
2
3
4

cssClasses.name: Container (l-container)
cssClasses.description: Max width container, centered with margin auto. Note: Demo is best viewed in standalone preview.
cssClasses.label: Container
cssClasses.template: l-container {% if className %}{{ className }}{%endif%} ()
cssClasses.preview: l-container ()

cssClasses.name: Content Grid (l-content-grid)
cssClasses.description: Standard two col grid with a content area and sidebar. This grid starts at bp-l. The sidebar width is to account for 300x250 ads. {{isWide}}
cssClasses.label: Content Grid
cssClasses.template:
Content

Sidebar
cssClasses.preview:
Content

Sidebar

cssClasses.name: Align (l-align-<position>)
cssClasses.description: Mostly used for centering and some assume a flex parent.
cssClasses.label: Align
cssClasses.template:
Example
{% if className == 'l-align-center-self' or className == 'l-align-end-self' %}Parent is display: flex{% endif %} {% if className == 'l-align-center-y' %}Parent is position: relative{% endif %}

cssClasses.name: Display  (l-display-<prop>)
cssClasses.description: Sometimes we need to make <a> tags block and <div> tags inline-block. We use these helpers to override a tag's default display type.
cssClasses.label: Display
cssClasses.template:
{% if className == 'l-clearfix' %}
Floated div
{% else %}
Example
{% endif %}

cssClasses.name: Multi column  (l-multicol)
cssClasses.description: Add 2 columns on larger viewports. In the future, this could be extended to support other column counts.

  • Swiss

  • Pepper Jack
  • Cheddar

cssClasses.name: Height (l-height-<size>)
cssClasses.description: Defines height settings. Helpful for grid, flexbox and buttons.
cssClasses.label: Height
cssClasses.template: I am a child div

cssClasses.name: Position (l-pos-<setting>)
cssClasses.description: Helper for quickly setting position: absolute or position: relative.
cssClasses.label: Position

cssClasses.name: Width (l-width-<size>)
cssClasses.description: Defines width settings. Helpful for responsive images.
cssClasses.label: Width

cssClasses.name: Political party colors (has-bg-<party>)
cssClasses.description: Optional colors that extend the standard color helpers. They're separated from the standard helpers to allow us to import them only when necessary.
cssClasses.label: Political party colors
cssClasses.template: Example

cssClasses.name: Text color (has-text-<color>)
cssClasses.description: Set the color of text.
cssClasses.label: Text color
cssClasses.template: Example

cssClasses.name: Hidden (is-hidden-<specifier>)
cssClasses.description: Contain !important flags to override other display rules.
cssClasses.label: Hidden
cssClasses.template: {{ className }}: Resize to see me appear/disappear

cssClasses.name: Margin (has-<size>-btm-marg)
cssClasses.description: Bottom margin only. Opt for these instead of adding margin-bottom to a new class.
cssClasses.label: Margin
cssClasses.template:
• Example
  • Example

cssClasses.name: Padding (has-padding)
cssClasses.description: Not all sizes are accounted for. Often, specific padding rules should go on a component.
cssClasses.label: Padding
cssClasses.template: {{ className }}

cssClasses.name: Screen Reader Only (is-sr-only)
cssClasses.description: Only visible to screen readers. Use this when you need to give the screen reader or page structure extra context that the design doesn't necessarily account call for. To perform the opposite, aka hide from screen readers, use aria-hidden="true". Reference
cssClasses.label: Screen Reader Only
cssClasses.template:
Title of content

Content of a section where design does not include heading. Inspect the page to see the hidden heading tag.
cssClasses.preview:
Title of content

Content of a section where design does not include heading. Inspect the page to see the hidden heading tag.

cssClasses.name: Text color:hover (has-text-hover-<color>)
cssClasses.description: Set the color of text on hover.

cssClasses.description: Helpers for borders.
